intro: Ornithogalum nanum, commonly known as the dwarf star-of-Bethlehem, is a small perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, grass-like foliage. The plant produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ornithogalum nanum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
